definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: There's a green gold rush on Capitol Hill.
sentences.chinese: 在國會山正在發生着一個綠色淘金熱。

sentences.english: Well, certainly, Mr. Naughton, you realize that you cannot buy votes on Capital Hill.
sentences.chinese: 當然，諾頓先生，你認識到你不能夠在國會山買選票。

sentences.english: Conflicting accounts of the radiation levels emerged in Tokyo and on Capitol Hill.
sentences.chinese: 關於核輻射標準的報告在東京和國會山出現分歧。

sentences.english: He eventually left Capitol Hill to work for UBS as an investment banker.
sentences.chinese: 他最終離開了國會山而成爲瑞銀的一名投資銀行家。

sentences.english: The agency got the kid-glove treatment on capitol hill.
sentences.chinese: 這個機構在國會山得到非常寬鬆的待遇。

sentences.english: The Democrats held a pep rally on Capitol Hill yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 民主黨昨天在國會山召開了競選誓師大會。

sentences.english: Mike O'Brien covers politics for The Hill newspaper in Washington.
sentences.chinese: 奧布賴恩爲華盛頓的《國會山》報紙作政治新聞報導。

sentences.english: Protectionist impulses run far too strong on Capitol Hill, especially in an election year.
sentences.chinese: 國會山的保護主義衝動過於激烈了，尤其在選舉年。

sentences.english: Republican St. The site is the border between commercial and multi-family zones of Capitol Hill.
sentences.chinese: 該圖書館位於邊境商業區和多住宅區的國會山附近。
